column4: my downloaded  .iso has correct checksum and i've successfully burned to a CD but when i try to install it, i see the ubuntu trademark for a while before i see the error: "can not mount /dev/loop0" > I googled but found no answer yet. Someone pls help me?
did you check the CD for defects once first booted to?
sorry, what do you mean by CD defects?
the full error is "Can not mount /dev/loop0 (/cdrom/casper/filesystem.squashfs) on //filesystem.squashfs"

when you boot to the CD you can tell the CD to test itself to see if the burn process was ok, on the same screen you can also test ram. When you start booting the CD pres SPACEBAR and the old school Ubuntu boot screen will show, you should check both
thans, I'll check that. back in a min
when i choose "Check CD defects"  menu option, i see a blackscreen fora while, and then it goes to the Ubuntu trademark and later on the error as above. Sounds like the CD is ok?
you will be told if its ok on screen in words :)
uhm.. this one doesn't sayanything, just goes straight to the install process i think...weird
if you need the extra features in the sun java, use sun
not sure if natty uses some gnome3 stuffs
you REALLY need to start adding the full versions. There is no ubuntu 10, there is 10.04 and 10.10
seems to have moved over, could make it into a script. Something like 'setwallpaper' ;)
yep, i am actually running it as a script to add my todolist to the desktop background, everytime i start my day. https://github.com/clu3/ubuntu-desktop-todo-list ^^
nice, I have similar but its a post install script called: dostuff
nice. i find todolist in the background image so much easier than opening another todolist app
